channel.title: BUbreakingHeadlines
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingHeadlines, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Kristi Noem secretly accepted huge sum of money from mystery donor - then failed to declare it: report
Supreme Court to decide whether shutting down Michigan pipeline is a state or federal fight
EV maker Rivian announces game-changing new partnership that will make drivers' lives easier: 'That's massive'

Microsoft says its AI diagnoses patients more accurately than doctors
Will Thom Tillis' opposition to Trump's megabill win over Senate GOP colleagues?
item.description: Senate Democratic Leader Chuck Schumer said many Republicans agree with Tillis.

item.title: Senate GOP tax bill could crush wind and solar power, advocates say

item.title: Senate holds "vote-a-rama" on Trump's "big, beautiful bill"
item.description: After debate on President Trump's massive tax bill stretched into early Monday, the Senate began a "vote-a-rama" on the "big, beautiful bill."

item.title: A man lured Idaho firefighters to a mountain with a fire then shot and killed 2, officials say
Best debt relief companies, plus advice borrowers need to know now
item.description: These debt relief companies could help you slash your debt, but there are a few things to know before signing up.

item.title: Boulder attack suspect faces murder charges after victim dies
item.description: The suspect in the June 1 attack on a march for Israeli hostages in Boulder, Colorado, will be charged with murder after one of the victims died.

item.title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs trial updates: Judge will instruct jury to continue deliberations
item.description: Hip-hop mogul Sean "Diddy" Combs is charged with sex trafficking and racketeering conspiracy.

item.title: Supreme Court to hear Republican challenge to campaign spending limits
item.description: The Supreme Court on Monday said it will hear a Republican challenge to limits on federal campaign spending in its next term.

item.title: Government contractor charged with driving circles on National Mall
item.description: Prosecutors allege the June 21 incident caused approximately $10,000 in damage.
